titleStmt.title: A declaration of the Cornish-men concerning the Prince of Wales; and the resolution of the two famous Garrisons of Plymouth and Portsmouth, concerning the Parliament and Army, and their engagement, to live and die together, for the defence and preservation of religion, government, liberty, and ereedome [sic]. Also, the princes declaration and speech touching the death of his father; and his design and resolution touching the Kingdom of Scotland. Imprimatur, Theodore Jennings.

A declaration of the Cornish-men concerning the Prince of Wales; and the resolution of the two famous Garrisons of Plymouth and Portsmouth, concerning the Parliament and Army, and their engagement, to live and die together, for the defence and preservation of religion, government, liberty, and ereedome [sic]. Also, the princes declaration and speech touching the death of his father; and his design and resolution touching the Kingdom of Scotland. Imprimatur, Theodore Jennings.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R.W. for general satisfaction of the Kingdom,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
